website_summaries.verdict: In addition to leaf blowing, the power tool converts for leaf collection with vacuum suction and mulching with a generous size collection backpack.
pros: Leaf collection backpack is generously sized, and said to be about twice as large as comparable models
Zipper-free backpack bag makes it easy to secure and release
Power boost button increases air force for better debris clearing
Blower works best for clearing debris from hard surfaces, and leaves from yards
Power output is up to 250 mph and 400 CFM
Flexible tube between blower and leaf bag
cons: Zipper-free bag does not secure shut as well as necessary
Mulching function does not work as well as expected

customer_reviews.title: On the third unit (so far)
customer_reviews.text: This is looking more and more like a piece of trash. The first one wouldn't turn on. The second one would run, but cut in and out due to some fault in the fan-guard switch. I looked at returning that one, but Amazon will refer you to the manufacturer instead of replacing it again. So I smashed it to pieces, and ordered another. I fully expect the third unit to have some flaw, after which I will have to go back to Toro brand leaf vacuums and their lousy, fragile collector bags. America was once able to make and sell quality tools and appliances. Black and Decker, a Chinese sellout, is typical of today's quality, sinking fast and faster.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Wictor

customer_reviews.title: Made short work of a yard full of leaves and figs
customer_reviews.text: We have a large fig tree and in the fall it drops very large, very thick leaves in addition to a bunch of small unripe figs. I used the blower to corral the leaves and the vacuum to shred them. It worked well even with really damp leaves. The manual doesn't cover this use case, but you can attach both the vacuum adapter and the blower tube at the same time. This allows you to simultaneously shred and pile up large volumes of leaves without worrying about emptying the bag. The vac/blower setup is powerful enough to shoot leaves 20+ feet.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: The body of the device will warp in heat. I’ve been storing the blower vac in my garage (Northern California) where Temperatures range about 100 to 105 in the heat of the summer. I’ve had a warranty replacement of the device once and the same thing happened to the replacement unit. The warp will cause a leak in the vaccum nozzle and no leaves will be picked up as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Joubindsay

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap construction. Failed within 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I had some reservations about ordering this item, due to recent bad experiences with Black and Decker equipment. After unpacking, we assembled it, and it ran for a grand total of 15 minutes vacuuming up some holly-bush leaves before the motor ceased operating. Checked for blockage in the fan, and nothing. The motor just quit, or perhaps a bad power switch. Very cheap plastic fan body, and certainly not designed for anything but VERY light duty use. It is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C. Edie

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but many flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Product idea is good but execution isn't. The first time using it created a hole in the tube which caused pieces of leaves to blow all over. It can get clogged and it is NOT easy to unclog!! The closure on the bag required clamps to hold it closed otherwise pieces of leaves flew everywhere. Best used on dry leaves with not a lot of sticks or debris. We made it work but it wasn't easy to do that!!!
customer_reviews.author: Debra D. Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: Sucks and blows with the best
customer_reviews.text: High power sucked up my pompas grass cuttings easily. Munches right through twigs. Bag fell off hose. I reattached with a 4 inch threaded adapter from the clothes dryer department. Backpack closure is brilliantly designed. Blower is powerful. Great value for about $100. Cons: sucking tube must be firmly attached, or it rocks loose the interlock. Plastic body could be thicker here. Bag came off hose, and i might have thrown away whatever locking collar it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Privacy Matters

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing! Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Blow all the leaves into a corner then switch to the vacuum/mulch and it sucks them all up into a backpack bag. It has very powerful suction. The backpack bag works great and holds quite a lot. The only minor annoyance is you have to use a screwdriver or hex key to poke a button through a hole to release the fan cover when switching between blower and vacuum/mulch. Safety feature I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: dangerous static buildup
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble assembling the unit, and it worked sort of for vacuuming yard debris, but had a plastic instead of metal impeller blade, and that caused massive static charge to build up and then shock me through leather gloves. Charge was strong enough to cause muscles to contract, and made it very difficult to use the vac. If they are going to use so much spinning plastic inside a plastic housing, thy should study some physics first. It should have used a grounded cable to drain off static discharge. I returned it. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Cooljonnorris

customer_reviews.title: Great dual equipment
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 very large live oak trees that are close to the house(never ever would do that again) that shed leaves pretty much year round and they are so small they get into everything and are almost impossible to sweep or rake up so decided to give this a try. Have not been able to use a lot but with what I have done I think we are going to be best friends because I was able to vacuum them into a bag and dump them without a huge fight or a ton of work. Easy to use, fairly light and the bag is very comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.author: Marvetta Wotton

customer_reviews.title: We have used this several times and it's super handy in our "just shy" of one acre of ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a home that sat empty for over a year and even prior to that a massive amount of leaves had accumulated. We have used this several times and it's super handy in our "just shy" of one acre of hilly property. The driveaway and small pockets of dips and steps look amazing in the yard now and all is much cleaner. You feel like a ghostbuster wearing it, but the portability can't be beat. It's pretty amazing how many leaves fit into this bag when they get mulched. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: skywatcher

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This has great suction power. The backpack makes it sooo much easier to use than the other B&D Vacuum. I didn’t get dirty from the bag on my back and it stayed closed. The part that you hold is lighter than the other one too and more ergonomic. This is way better than the one I’ve used for years. I still have it, but I probably won’t use the old one again! I can’t comment on the durability since today was the first day I tried it. It picked up all the leaves as well as thin sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Polly S Keeling

customer_reviews.title: Bag is Junk!
customer_reviews.text: At 71 yrs old, having the back straps is great BUT the bag is a piece of junk! It has NO zipper. It is wide open end-to-end. You fold it over then connect the male/female plastic connectors so you actually use on 80% of the capacity. My old B&D Vac had a cancas zipper bag and was great! The bag is junk! If you try to seal it so debris doesn't blow out it blows the opening wide open and all the leaf debris blows all over the yard. Just plain poor design!
customer_reviews.author: Danpb

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it - very dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: Very dissapointing. I don't write reviews, but this one deserves it. The leaf suction is basically worthless. In no way is this easier or more efficient than just manually raking the leaves. The vacuum does not suck up leaves like you think it will. I have a smaller yard in the city and I basically gave up on this after half an hour because I would have been sucking handfuls of leaves at a time for the rest of the wknd. Way faster and easier to just rake and put into bags. Then when you factor in dealing the chord, the cost, the clogging - totally not worth it. Would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Blower/Vacuum shuts off for no obvious reason.  Tried with 2 other cords/3 sockets, same results
customer_reviews.text: Extremely powerful blower/vacuum/mulcher, but...it operates intermittently. I experimented with two different power cords in three different sockets. Then I tried other electrical appliances with the same two power cords in the same outlets. They all worked, but the B&D blower/vacuum won't work. Is there some sort of internal cut off switch? It worked perfectly for about 20 minutes this morning. But when I stopped to empty the bag and put the bag harness on my back, the unit would not start up again. I had the exact same problem with the first unit I had to return after a few days for the same reason.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Valenty

customer_reviews.title: Stop Functioning 2 weeks after the return window closed
customer_reviews.text: Way better than expected when we got it. Two weeks after the window closed for a return to amazon, it is no longer functioning properly. It turns off on its own and must be fiddled with to get it to stay on. Projects taking twice a long as they should. We are looking into the manufacturer's warranty. But, suggest that you choose a different product.
customer_reviews.author: SusanF

customer_reviews.title: Works well on small dry leaves
customer_reviews.text: Spent a full day with the vacuum collecting small to medium leaves that were pretty dry. Pretty much the perfect suction power for the job. Left the rocks on the ground but collected the leaves and acorns from the ground. Cleared a large area without raking very easily. Another section where the leaves were more surrounded by grass, I did rake the leaves into a pile then vacuumed. Only clogged the intake once and it was easily cleared by just reaching into the large intake tube. Did not use the backpack bag as I would have filled it up really quickly. Used the add on trash can adapter which worked well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Described
customer_reviews.text: Works great! I pushed it pretty hard trying to pick up wet sycamore leaves, which it struggled with and frequently plugged, but that was a completely unreasonable request for an electric vacuum. Waited until things dried up more and this thing is a beast on dry leaves. We have bradford pear, sycamore, and maple trees in our subdivision and it handles those (dry) with ease and chops them up fine. Backpack is good sized and fits me well, even though I am pretty large. I was able to empty the bag without taking it off and get back to work.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Earl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I'm a 67 year-old woman average strength so I was worried about it being a little too heavy for me but it is not! I don't have any issues with it at all it works perfectly and believe me I have massive amounts of leaves in my yard from my 3 ginormous maple trees. I am so very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine vac/blower - cheezy hose
customer_reviews.text: The blower/vacuum works fine, but the hose is thin and within minutes had holes all over the place because I had picked up small twigs with the leaves, and they poked holes in the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for the money. I use it as a leaf vacuum only, since I had a leaf blower already. The vacuum feature saves so much time compared to leaf blowing or raking and filling bags. With the leaf vacuum, I can just empty the pouch into a bin or lawn bag instead of scooping leaves up off the ground. The suction bogs down slightly if wet leaves are picked up, which is to be expected. But, the fan compartment is very easy to clean out so you can keep going.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mainly for leaf vacuuming of a side yard composed of pea gravel and artificial turf, both of which are difficult to rake. Worked like a champ to vacuum turf, and also did pretty well on the gravel, though I had to be careful to find that sweet spot to suck up the leaves without also picking up gravel. With larger gravel, this would likely not be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Blower is good... bag is horrible...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried to use this now 3x's. The vacuum is relatively strong. My biggest issue is the bag that comes with it. It simply does not close well at all. When you go to use it, the leaves that you suck up will get mulched up and bits and pieces will come flying out of the back of the bag - it simply does not seal well. It got to the point where I had to get a clip from the kitchen to try to hold it shut, which also didn't work out well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Best lawn care product purchase I’ve made in years.
customer_reviews.text: I can get a bit obsessive about our lawn, and this is the most satisfying lawn care purchase I have made in years. Go ahead and leave the powerboat button on all of the time. The backpack collection bag is AWESOME! I am so happy that I will not be shlepping around with a bag in one hand and the yard vac in the other this year one the leaves fall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small backyard
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I was looking for: it picks up dried leaves scattered in my small backyard, shreds them and bags them. (I have no need for the blower function.) The shredded leaves can be used for compost or mulch. If you stick to this, I think it's perfect. (Ear muffs strongly recommended, if you value your hearing.) However, it's slow to shred the leaves, and so I would not recommend it for working on piles of dried leaves. Also, if you have branches or vines, it will clog up and require frequent cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: E. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Decent for small jobs. Button got stuck after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: I think it is good buy. It is not a pro tool but it gets the job done for my house. I question the quality of it and wonder if it will last. The on/off button (slides up and down) already got stuck and it is very hard to move now. A senior person would have difficulties to turn it on/off in my case and probably wouldn't be able to use. We will see how long it will last. For the price, I think it is good even if it lasts one year for the amount of work I had to do saving me time and from hiring someone to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited for this product. Assembly and use was very easy and simple. Product has very weak power when blower or vacuum. A light breeze is more likely to move leaves than this blower. While using it as a leaf vacuum (during the first use an hour after unboxing) the gasket on the hose blew. An absolute piece of junk. Product was terrible and useless and then it broke on its first use. Save yourself and buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: We have some (city required) oak trees in front of our house that constantly fill the street and driveway with leaves. I initially thought about getting the leaf vac with the small bag, but this one was on sale. It works well - the blower rounds up the leaves and the vac pulls them all in. Big capacity and easy to empty.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not for seed pods. Effectively seeds your yard.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't strong enough to suckered up most seed pods completely, they go up the chute break open and effectively seed your whole yard with what you were trying to remove. This has caused a huge headache for the next year of my life.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with the suction power.
customer_reviews.text: As a blower it was fine. Not happy with the suction power. If you only plan on suction for very dry leaves it will work fine. But large leaves, a little wet, acorns or fallen nuts mixed in, small twigs.... no. I can rake the dry leaves quickly without using this tool. I was hoping it would have the suction power for a ton of fallen acorns.
customer_reviews.author: BG Acct

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely buy this
customer_reviews.text: This turned leaf raking into fun! All I did was blow all my leaves against my fence and then I sucked them all up! I have a pretty large yard and only had to empty the bad twice! Assembly was easy and so fast emptying the bag. I highly recommend this product, made my life so much easier
customer_reviews.author: julianne

customer_reviews.title: Light to carry, Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these 15 years ago and this new model is a wonderful improvement. I like the backpack style collection bag much better than the over the shoulder one. The folding closure is so much easier than the zipper was. It's powerful and light weight. I'm a woman in my 60s and I purchased a corded electric model because I don't want to carry the weight of either a battery or motor. I wish I didn't have to use a tool to switch between blowing and vaccuuming, but it's a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: SKS

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with this blower/vacuum. It me a minute to figure out how to put it together..meaning blower vs. vacummn but after that is was smooth sailing. It was a tad on the heavy side (I am 5'3" but not unmanageable.) The backpack feature is also super handy. The mulching feature works well because I definitely vacuumed some small twigs and it handled them well. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B.

customer_reviews.title: Great vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite yard tool - clears leaves and shreds them. Best for clearing lawns and shrubs, much easier than a rake. Vacuum works for flat spaces like driveways but a rake works better there. Bag holds as much as I could manage, stronger people might prefer a larger bag. Easy to manage so it doesn’t clog, and clogs are easy to clear. Well designed tool.
customer_reviews.author: Beth S

customer_reviews.title: Twice tried, Twice disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it the first time, and the fan cover didnt work for the blower. Refunded and new one arrived but this time NONE OF IT WORKED!! Do not buy... defective parts and low-to-none quality control on B&D's side of the house. Amazon: Drop this item.
customer_reviews.author: RoldanCastillo Family

customer_reviews.title: Died on the Second Use
customer_reviews.text: Bought in October 2018, used one time and 8 month later tried to use it again and the switch failed. Covered by Black and Decker's warranty, but I have to bring to a Black and Decker Service Center. Nearest Black and Decker Service Center is nearly 60 miles from where I live. Lose a 1/2 days pay and drop off, then lose another 1/2 of day to pick up after being fixed or throw out are my choices. I could also pay shipping each way instead of dropping off and picking up.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Works great for reducing leaves
customer_reviews.text: Works great for reducing leaves. Can be a little finicky about mulching, but stopping to clean out every now and then and it works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: J Baccus

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Quite literally the single best tool I've ever purchased. Made cleaning up my leaves a simple chore, despite still taking some time. It was pretty easy to blow the leaves all into straight lines, then switch to vac and suck them all up.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Below average very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This item cannot handle leaves that are damp. I have used it and had to remove the cover and clean out the suction/wheel area twice. Very time consuming. I ran the blower and was disappointed. My old toro bought 10 years ago blows much stronger. Very little power.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Collins

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The Zipperless bag did not close enough to keep the mulched stuff in.
customer_reviews.author: maggie effie

customer_reviews.title: Great blower, decent vaumm/mulcher
customer_reviews.text: The blower function is great. Really blows air and can move wet leafs or dry leafs. The vacuum section isn't great but works on dry leafs pretty well. If the leafs are even a little wet they get stuck in all sorts of areas and it's much faster to just blow them into a pile and use a rake to put everything in the bin. I carry a screw driver with me to clear out the sucking part around the blade because it gets jammed pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hogan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my hubby. By the time we went to use it in April to vacuum the leaves out of our rocks, it was too late to do a return. Because it has a "zipperless" bag (it has two metal pieces that bend together to "hold tight"), once you vacuum up leaves, it mulches them and shoots them right out the back of the bag! So your no longer left cleaning up big leaves out of your rocks, you have tiny mulched up leaves to try and pick up! TERRIBLE PRODUCT! Fortunately Amazon let me return it, with a $25 shipping fee. Live and learn :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: I think they measured the wind speed in the middle of a tornado because my truck exhauste blows more air than this thing. Very pissed I waited so long to use it. Now I can't even return it. It's a total water of money
customer_reviews.author: Justin Campos

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price and does the job
customer_reviews.text: This was a powerhorse and I put it to work the first time I used it. I loved the functionality and it worked very well. It has a good amount of suction and it chipped pretty fine. If there is any moisture, it will most likely jam up in the tube right before the blade. It is a little odd to set up and get on. Once it is on, it is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: Good as a leaf blower ONLY
customer_reviews.text: As a blower, it works pretty well. As a vacuum, it's absolutely WORTHLESS. The only way to get any suction out of this is to lay the bag on the ground with the flexible tube stretched out in a straight line...then it has enough suction to maybe vacuum up a few leafs. As soon as you try to pick it up, the hose bends and the minuscule amount of power this thing has drops to zero. It would be a lot faster to pick up a pile of leaves with your bare hands using no tools of any kind than to try to use this to vacuum them up.
customer_reviews.author: FritzTheCat

customer_reviews.title: Easy, clean
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my yard. It sucks up leaves, but not rocks. I hate instruction manuals, and easily put it together without using it. So easy to use and made my yard so clean. I wish I got this 13 years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Jacoby

customer_reviews.title: Very effective, well priced.
customer_reviews.text: The mulcher function is incredible and much more effective than anticipated. The blower function is much less effective than anticipated and I found this disappointing. Overall, because the vacuum/mulcher is so good, I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Best one I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several different kinds over the years and none of them work this well. The bag as a backpack is brilliant and it holds a lot. It may seem a little underpowered for blowing but to vacuum, it is great even on wet leave. I highly recommend it so far want to see how long the impeller lasts wish it were metal but for the money this is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: M. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Plastic impeller
customer_reviews.text: Great vacuum/mulcher, but disappointed that comes from the factory with a plastic impeller. After using the mulcher a few times and vacuuming some acorns, which can't be avoided under an oak, the impeller fins were all bent. It is possible to get a replacement, metal impeller part nr 90593175 fits and it is easy to replace. Though the vacuum should've come with a metal impeller in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Does not do what is says it will.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do NOT buy this product. Sounds great right!?! I mean no more bending over to scoop up leaves!! WRONG!! It will mulch up the leaves then drop them back out the suction tube making a more of a mess than if you just raked them up in the first place. Please mark my words and keep the box for your return.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Davis

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought less than one year ago, used for about 4 months off and on. Pulled it out for the first time this year, worked for about 5 minutes then just quit. Nothing wrong with power source. Tried to contact Black and Decker but they keep having “errors” when I am on their site trying to send an email to support.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hotz

customer_reviews.title: Electric blower with long cord and no fumes!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Electric, long cord, no fumes! Blows leaves and suctions leaves too! Best Buy for a property with lots of trees! Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: JEM(Jaden E Michiko)

customer_reviews.title: The hose is difficult to remove from the blower when ...
customer_reviews.text: The hose is difficult to remove from the blower when trying to empty bag. Need to make a steel blade for cutting up small tree twigs.
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: TROUBLE
customer_reviews.text: IT'S HARD TO HANDLE DO TO THE HANDLE IS BACKWARDS, SO IT HURTS YOUR WRIST
customer_reviews.author: BLACK SUPERMAN

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I've made in 15 years.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I hate raking. Easy to use, the backpack is brilliant. Mulches everything up really small so its easy to put in a garbage bag. It is a bit difficult to switch between leaf vacuum and leaf blower so I plan on only using it as a vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Kofoed Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I'd pay double
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fun to use. It's powerful. The blower is better than my other blower. The cap that creates a smaller hole makes it weaker so I just chucked it. The mulcher is a beast. Chokes down leaves way faster than expected. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Joseph McGuinness (Ray Ray's Records)

customer_reviews.title: Good product so far
customer_reviews.text: Used today for the first time. Works as advertised. Vacuumed up heavy wet oak leaves no problem. Seems like a quality machine. The bag closing method isn't intuitive (we tend to expect zippers) but it's easy to connect and unroll for emptying. And no cheap zippers to break. I like it and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lfur

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this in its vacuum configuration. It is a very gnarly leaf vac. It picks up sticks and everything else and grinds it all up. The plastic impeller s surprisingly robust. Stuff does get clogged occasionally but it’s very simple to open up and clean out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: This works great as blower and vacuum/ mulcher
customer_reviews.text: This works great as blower and vacuum/ mulcher. It cuts down the amount of trash dramatically. I find the backpack bag that holds the mulched leaves works great if you roll the closure over 4 Times.
customer_reviews.author: Lakehawkes

customer_reviews.title: FELL APART IN 2 HOURS
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to vacuum up leaves. The suction was fine but the hose and the backpack completely fell apart after my first use. I’m going to find out if I can return it. If not, I’m going to throw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: Blower A+, Bag F-
customer_reviews.text: The blower/vacuum works perfectly. The bag is a piece of crap. After ONE use, the bag no longer closes tight enough to keep the leaves / much from blowing back onto your lawn. You spend more time trying to keep the bag closed than you do cleaning your lawn. It's literally worthless. And we've tried clamps, ties, grips, up to the point it just becomes an incredible hassle. Save your money and get a real blower/vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to wear and a bit heavy but manageable.
customer_reviews.text: Great at picking up leaves, but does not pick up berries or fallen nuts. A great help in keeping my small garden tidy!
customer_reviews.author: NYCutie

customer_reviews.title: I was disappointed the vacuum part was so huge too - I ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband tried to use it and says it has very little sucking power or blowing power. So we are returning it. I was disappointed the vacuum part was so huge too - I was hoping to be able to get just a few leaves here and there but that's not feasible with the way this is designed.
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: I use this mostly for the vacuum feature. For the price, it works well. There are some leaves that Are too large for the hose, so I wish it picked up all size leaves. It does help me keep the leaves Under control, and that’s what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Authenticate First

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum is more effective than the blower
customer_reviews.text: You see people blowing leaves around. Unless they are into the gutter for the City to take care of, blowing does not solve the problem. But, the vacuum does the job; picks them up into the backpack, which you then put into a disposal bin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Grinds up the leaves to save space. Helps out with my bad back. Only bought it to vacuum leaves.
customer_reviews.author: leurinimj

customer_reviews.title: Item only worked 1 time
customer_reviews.text: Item only worked 1 time and would not turn back on. The bag had frays in it upon arrival. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cathartic and useful
customer_reviews.text: I have a battery powered blower, but the vacuum mode is perfect for collecting leaves from around and behind bushes where it can be hard to rake. And it chops them up - I wouldn’t call it mulch, but it takes up a lot less room in a lawn bag. Recommend: double check that all accessories are out before assembling- some of mine were hiding in the collector tube. Also, find a lawn bag funnel- it really makes it east to empty the leaf back pack
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love the backpack
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Blower is very strong. Vacuum is good. Could be lighter to hold but overall I chose this over a lot of brands. Surprised at its quality and power. Price was great
customer_reviews.author: Gianfranco Vaccaro

customer_reviews.title: Makes cleaning up leaves so easy!
customer_reviews.text: Great suction. Easy to use and easy to clean put the bag. The backpack part is what made us purchase this one over the others and I can tell you it makes it so much easier. I only wish we would have bought this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Buy only for mulching function!
customer_reviews.text: Without the added tube length, the mulcher is amazing! But the suction power with the added tubing isn’t as great and thus causes blockage too frequently. Don’t even try to use this as a blower, it’s sad!
customer_reviews.author: M. Watson

customer_reviews.title: High hopes but let down
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this to make my leaf pick up easier. I mainly use it as a vacuum. The hose won't stay connected to the plastic piece that connects it to the machine part! A lot of good it does if you suck up leaves and blow them back out because your hose has disconnected! I tried to use another zip tie but it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S.

customer_reviews.title: Good suction
customer_reviews.text: We bought one for our son and loved it so much he bought one for us. Good quality product. Good for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over promise, under deliver.
customer_reviews.text: It works a lot stronger in their video than it does in real life. I wanted a second blower but find my first one, now 10 years old, was probably 50% stronger and smaller to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Just not enough power to suck up my maple leaves. Very disappointed. Also clogs easily
customer_reviews.author: janice kirchhoff

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: This leaf blower is absolutely worthless. I have used it for a little over a month now and it’s already falling apart. The line that leads from the unit to the backpack is held in place by a zip-tie, which I’ve had to replace almost every time I use it due to the tube disconnecting. Now the tube is starting to deteriorate and cannot be used. Save your money and buy a higher quality leaf blower/vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: jared Snyder

customer_reviews.title: A bit bulky!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned products like these before however this one is a bit bulky and the bag is difficult to use. Emptying it is a real process. I’ll keep it but won’t enjoy emptying it
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: works as promised
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit difficult to put together (minimal instructions) but it worked well once it was assembled. Suction was very good. Have not used the blower yet as it involves more taking apart and putting together. It is relatively light weight which was important. Basically, it performs as promised.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Great performance over all
customer_reviews.text: great product overall could use more suction power. I am pleased with its performance over all great value for the money
customer_reviews.author: GlennT

customer_reviews.title: I am sending it BACK
customer_reviews.text: My unit came in and worked for about 3 mins and then cut off. For some reason it would not turn on again. I called Black and Decker and they said just return it to Amazon. Great customer service. I will be getting refund and looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Meadows

customer_reviews.title: compresses leaves into wonderful leaf mulch
customer_reviews.text: The backpack was a great feature, to provide mobility. The backpack bag was simple to open for cleaning out. We cleaned up a large area of the driveway in short order and now have bags of leaf mulch. Good power and suction.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Graziano

customer_reviews.title: Assembly
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum works well. It is not easy to reach leaves when you are limited in range. I found it worked better when I only put the pack on my left shoulder (right handed). The unlock mechanism for the chute is difficult to disconnect. I keep pressing the release button but doesn't always work.
customer_reviews.author: jim funka

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: This thing did a great job of my yard the suction could be stronger for wet leaves but it got all the dry ones up.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea J. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Died after one month
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in October 2019 for leaf cleanup and now in November, does not work at all. Will not start (switch issue?). The blower was very ineffective, so purchased a gas powered blower, so just used this for shredding / mulching leaves. Now the machine does not even turn on. I have an older model B+D blower/vacuum which I am forced to use since this one does not work.
customer_reviews.author: brownthum

customer_reviews.title: Great leaf mulcher
customer_reviews.text: The B & D mulch design is awesome for leaves and very small twigs. The best part is the mulch bag back pack. It can be completely full and you don’t struggle with it as you keep filling it. Must buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Worked twice for us and then now doesn’t work. Then the seller said it’s cause we used improper cord. Don’t waste your time with this product. Your better off getting a cordless that’s NOT black and decker
customer_reviews.author: Ash Nagel

customer_reviews.title: Awkward
customer_reviews.text: This is so bulky, awkward, and heavy I can hardly use it on our small porches and decks.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kohler

customer_reviews.title: Great for small jobs not for large jobs
customer_reviews.text: Good for small jobs such as flower beds or Bush clean up. Bag doesnt hold much.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Sucks up leaves like a pro but--
customer_reviews.text: vacuum works really good, but the blower is lacking. You need to be on a cement area for the blower to do any good at all. If they can fix the blower it would be a great tool.
customer_reviews.author: westhemess

customer_reviews.title: works as promised
customer_reviews.text: It is a little difficult to handle (put on and off the collection bag) manuvering the tubes, etc...but it gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: B. Scott Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: Will not pick up dry leaves on dry grass. Works well picking up leaves off pavement. Will not pick up cottonwood leaves at all.
customer_reviews.author: rick groce

customer_reviews.title: Works surprisingly well.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to blow and mulch leaves. It has the power to do everything I've asked of it. I wish the back pack was bigger. It is a chore emptying out the bag when vacuuming lots of leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Vardon

customer_reviews.title: Too Weak, So Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This think has little power... slow to pick-up. Can't handle too many leaves at once. Raking is faster. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: DeWcandles

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Buy
customer_reviews.text: The easy of not having to take leaves any longer. However, I wish the bad could hold more but it does get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: MS. HEALTHCARE

customer_reviews.title: Hose is full of holes already
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mostly for the vacuum/mulcher function for the leaves in my lawn. It worked fine for the most part, albeit very slowly. It only works well with leaves that are mostly dry - if they're wet at all, the mulcher will get clogged. The reason it gets two stars is that the hose that goes from the mulcher to the bag is already falling apart - today was my third afternoon using it, and there are already four holes in the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Sherilyn

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job. The only down side is emptying the bag into a recycling bag. It is no worse than other units of this size and better than many however it still is a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Filer

customer_reviews.title: Great leaf blower/mulcher!
customer_reviews.text: My husband was able to clear our tennis court of mounds of leaves this spring! It only took him a few hours. Stamp of approval!
customer_reviews.author: Peachie

customer_reviews.title: Really well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice 3-in-1. The suction bag on the back is really nice because it keeps it out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald-Belle River, ON

customer_reviews.title: Powerful blower/vacuum
customer_reviews.text: My son used this and said it was fantastic! It vacuumed up tons of leaves and other stuff in a short amount of time. The blower is also very powerful. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Janet A. Guzalak

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Had a pile of leaves and this machine would not pick up any of them it’s a very low powered vacuum not good for yards in anyway
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All around just a great purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this vacuum- blower. The best feature is the backpack type bag. Had on before years back and the worst thing about it was the shoulder sling type bag. Hard to handle and drag around. This one is very easy to use and haul and unload. Would most definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy W.

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER BEBL7000 Power Boost Blower/Vacuum
product_meta.description: Style:Blower/Vacuum3-In-1 backpack leaf blower, vacuum, and mulched dominates debris with up to 250 mph of blowing velocity and powerful suction for picking up leaves and more. Power boost button provides extra power when needed, and the zipper-free bag makes emptying quick and easy. Perfect for clearing sidewalks, driveways, and other hard surfaces after mowing, edging, and trimming. Flexi-tube for maneuverability while vacuuming leaves and debris. Quick release bag enables easy emptying of leaf collection bag. Includes: blow tube, vac tube, and easy-to-wear backpack bag. This product is manufactured in Canada. This product meets customer requirement.
feature_bullets: Easy to wear backpack with up to 2 times bag capacity
Power boost button for increased power on demand.Uses:Blower is ideal for clearing debris from hard surfaces and leaves from yard
Zipper free bag with wide opening for quick emptying
Up to 250 mph and 400 CFM for powerful performance
Converts from leaf blower to leaf vacuum
Air Speed: 250 mph; Bag: Reusable Bushels; Included Components: (1) BEBL7000, (1) Blow Tube, (1) Vac Tube, (1) Backpack Bag; Mulch Ratio: 16:1

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars709 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
